sources.title: TrueGlory1945
sources.description: Title: The True Glory Summary: A documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from the footage shot by nearly one thousand four hundred cameramen. It opens as the assembled Allied ... Directed by: Garson Kanin, Carol Reed Actors: Production Company: Ministry of Information Release Date: 4 October 1945 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from the footage shot by nearly one thousand four hundred cameramen. It opens as the assembled Allied forces plan and train for the D-Day invasion at bases in Great Britain, and covers all of the major events of the war in Europe, from the Normandy landings, to the fall of Berlin.

sources.title: The True Glory (1945)
sources.description: The True Glory (1945) is a co-production of the US Office of War Information and the British Ministry of Information, documenting the victory on the Western Front, from Normandy to the collapse of the Third Reich. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/the-true-glory-1945/

metadata.Plot: A documentary account of the allied invasion of Europe during World War II compiled from the footage shot by nearly one thousand four hundred cameramen. It opens as the assembled Allied forces plan and train for the D-Day invasion at bases in Great Britain, and covers all of the major events of the war in Europe, from the Normandy landings, to the fall of Berlin.
metadata.Writer: Harry Brown, Paddy Chayefsky, Frank Harvey
metadata.Actors: Dwight D. Eisenhower, Leslie Banks, Winston Churchill
